creator: simon.tutek@gmail.com
text:
I have dual AMD Opteron server with Fedora Core 3.

configure script fails with: "configure: error: Unsupported CPU architecture
"x86_64".

I maneged to pass this by inserting:
 x86_64)
    CFLAGS="$CFLAGS -DCPU=\\\"k8\\\"" ;;

at line 2636 in configure script.

It is obvious that this solution works only for AMD 64 bit. So please add
support for 64 bit processors.

creator: yoavs@computer.org
text:
Please provide a complete patch including detection of your K8 before we add 
your CFLAGS modification by itself.  

As an aside, a generic request such as "please add support for 64 bit 
processors" is not likely to ever be addressed as such.  A specific one for K8 
with a patch will get done.

Thanks for reporting this.
*** Bug 33584 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
creator: funkman@joedog.org

text:
Created attachment 14544
Ugly patch for Opteron processors

This is a quick and drty patch, writen for bash shell on a linux box. Hopefuly
it helps and is not too hard to port.
creator: simon.tutek@gmail.com
simon.tutek@gmail.com
text:
Created attachment 14547
Same patch - otherway around (Ugly patch for opteron)

(Same as before)

simon.tutek@gmail.com
text:
FROM bug 34192:

(In reply to comment #4)
> Resolving duplicate to get everything on one thread.
> 
> Ok, I've got three different values suggested for CPU (this one, the one 
> currently in apsupport.m4, and the one from 33494), and no access to this arch 
> myself.  A little help here please ;-).


Please let us know what do you need. 
I would invest a bit of time to help and hopefuly get it working as it should.
Simon 

I have also some issues with jsvc and jdk1.5 64BIT. I 'll take a look at it a
little bit later (next week or so).

text: *** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 35403 ***

creator: markt@apache.org
text: Changed resolution to INVALID since duplicate bug has been deleted from Bugzilla and leaving as DUPLICATE creates referential integrity issues for the underlying database.
